My old roommate had laser removal done on his. He went through tons of treatment and it never fully went away. It works differently on everyone. If its a smaller piece then better chances of it going away. I'm not sure what your stance on tattoo's all around are, but another option would be a cover up.

I call them voices, but really it's just me thinking the thoughts. I dissociate them to me because I can't control what it is saying or make it stop. So it's not like some morgan freeman is ranting in my head. I like to jokingly call it my inner dialogue. Movies actually portray the thoughts correctly but not the emotion associated with it. My head can say shit all day, but when it starts fucking with my feelings I know something bad is going down.
I was in the shower moments ago, shaving yknow. For some reason I thought it would be a great idea to run the razor across my face (which I ended up not doing). Also there was the cutest little frog in there :D. Today I seem to be very absent.. The voices are just very random not really relating towards anything. ON OTHER OCCASIONS they are usually very mean :(. Some real live quotes coming atcha "That dude is fucking ugly what a piece of shit." "It would feel so good to listen to him dying" "Can you imagine the blood flowing over your hands as you strangle the life out of them?" "You should rape her, she would probably enjoy it.". And when they concern me "You're a fucking psycho how could anyone love something like you?" "You know there is no hope you'll never be better" "You're fine there's nothing wrong with you stop being a pussy".

I like to think that reincarnation is real. Once we die we get reborn as a different person and sometimes dreams can be windows to what past lives were like. Over time your general personality changes and is morphed by certain things that happen.
I also like to think that the universe is a huge ocean. Maybe we are just floating around on a tiny spick of sand in a huge ocean. Other planets are other little particles of sand, and somewhere out there, there are giant fish swimming around.

Feeling fine for the first time in a while! Sorry for the downvotes I thought this was a good idea at least.
Suicide. I've come close a lot, and still do on occasion but just continuing to experience different things makes me glad I haven't gone through with it yet.

Don't cut people out of your life because you feel you are dragging them down. He is your boyfriend, talk to him. Tell him that you've been feeling depressed and tell him why. He will want to be by your side and help you.

Social interaction is something everyone enjoys. If you are giving someone attention they will love it. Don't force it on them, but don't be too reserved. Try talking to strangers in public. Cashiers, waiters/waitresses, people that it doesn't matter if you come off as awkward or anything because guaranteed you'll never see them again. Simple stuff like "how has your day been?" is a good starter, ask open ended questions so they can give a chance to talk a lot about themselves, people love to talk about themselves.
In what ways is he harassing her? Is there any way to prove it? Don't resort to violence it won't solve anything and will just make your situation worse.
Actually just using it because switching would be a hassle and there are a few things I've posted tonight that I don't want on my main account.

Everyone has something to talk about, just gotta find the right topics. Me and you are complete strangers and we're having a conversation right now :). I know a few people who aren't very talkative, not because they are shy, but just don't talk much. That doesn't mean I don't enjoy spending time with them, hell they're the best kind of people to have around when I'm just trying to relax going hiking or am at the gym.

Subscribe to subs that relate to your interests and discuss ideas with people :). Reddit Gold is really just a way to donate to the site, it gives whoever has it small features that you can get through just using reddit enhancement suite.

Just be yourself with people. Don't be negative enjoy your time spent with others and they'll enjoy spending time with you. You don't need a strong relationship with your family. You might try to push people away because you're afraid of someone getting too close, I do the same thing but probably for a much different reason. Don't be afraid to open up to people. Just be careful who you open up to.
It gets better if you let it. If your depressed talk to someone who can help. It won't get better if you don't try to change whatever it is that's making you feel down.
Darkness enters as fast as light leaves. So technically the same as the speed of light.

You can't see anything in the future new things happen every day that take us by surprise and completely change our perspectives. Even if you don't see it, do you want it? There are endless options out there, if being a pilot doesn't work out there are still so many opportunities to travel. You see yourself as a loner, so put yourself out there! Talk to people, we all fail at conversations or mess up with women occasionally but being able to brush it off is something that you need to learn to do. You can find people your compatible with no matter what, look for groups who are interested in the same kind of things you are.
Write out a list of things you want to do. Do them one at time and check them off the list. Enjoy yourself, go out talk to random people.
just how expensive groceries were.

You need to be much more specific. Start asking yourself big questions. Would you just be happy as a pilot? Do you want to settle down have any sort of family? Would you be willing to give up family to be a pilot? My uncle used to be a pilot in the air force and moved on to be a commercial pilot, he has a family but he only sees them a few months out of the year.

Hit the books. Random walk down Wallstreet is a great intro. Also the first book I read on investing and I loved it. http://www.amazon.com/Random-Walk-Down-Wall-Street/dp/0393340740/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8 qid=1367820864 sr=8-1 keywords=random+walk+down+wall+street
Can't go wrong with simplicity. A close friend of mine got simply the word hope tattooed on her wrist.

But what is your definition of successful? If you think it is a slim chance do you have other options that you would like to follow? It sounds like you have a passion for flying, if the Air force doesn't work out, you should consider the navy. They have lots of pilots and I'm not 100% positive, but it's probably a lot less competitive than the Air force. Things take time. Don't be discouraged if they didn't work out the first time.

It sounds like you don't give a lot of credit to yourself, so if your self-depreciating around people they might not enjoy spending time around you.

As someone who experiences hallucinations regularly, I can honestly say a lot doesn't scare me anymore. I guess even still the scariest are when I see a lot at once and just want it to go away but it won't. Sometimes they can be threatening, other times it just seems like I'm walking through hell. My brain doesn't like me.

As of now it's not clear, my medication doesn't seem to be working so after we adjust it and hope we get it right then I'll have a clearer understanding of what will end up happening.

Hallucinations really range depending on how bad my anxiety or depression is at the moment. They can be anything from like little things moving around on the walls and floor to actual people. When I had made this post, I was going through a moment of increased hallucinations both auditory and visually. I saw things like a black dog in my mirror, I felt like I was being watched and knew something was in the room with me, a hanger I have with ties on it started shaking a lot. I heard doors closing, and people talking in my bathroom. I heard my name being called out a lot. Stuff like that. They can be and usually are extremely terrifying.

No. There is also no reason I would go running around shooting people... Just because I don't understand why certain things are considered wrong, doesn't mean I don't know that they are wrong. I would never harm a person for no reason, I would end up fucking up my own life for a stupid flow of anger I had for a small moment.

Not belittling, perfectly normal question. I know its in my head. I don't think that would work. What you're talking about is how some people treat depression. Everyone who tries to cope with depression or suppress memories alone does it in a different way. For me in particular I was manifesting it in my head as anger and violence. Eventually building up to the point where it was comforting. Severe cases of depression could lead to other mental disorders which is what happened in my case. I took anti-depressants and they didn't work well, because by that point it was no longer just depression.
Ha he doesn't look too tough, unlike the face in the wall...

You're close. Schizophrenia is a form of psychosis, just like psychotic depression is. Symptoms are shared since they are both psychosis. The anti-psychotics I'm taking are the same as what schizophrenics take.

Mine is different because it manifests itself through auditory or visual hallucinations as well as having paranoid thoughts/feelings that I'm being watched or people are judging me. The sociopathic tendencies stem from my interaction with people. It's not that I have moments, but the fact that I just use people, manipulate and lie. Watching others suffer makes me feel good in some ways.

No problem, ask as many as you want. Getting out more regardless of how crappy I feel. It always helps to push myself out, but not to be pushed out. If you have a friend you're worried about give them opportunities to do things invite them places and don't get upset if they say no. I don't want to generalize because there are different kinds of depression, and mine is very different from normal depression which it seems like you're aiming towards.

Hmm good questions they seem scripted... I'm open about my depression not so much the psychosis. Whenever I tell people I'm depressed I hate when they ask why, and I try to tell them, but then they start hounding me with life stories so they can try to empathize. It doesn't seem empathizing it just makes me feel like they don't care/want to talk about themselves. So don't do that, just listen to what they have to say.
This question is cyclical. If I knew the thoughts that I had then I would have the thoughts that I have, so meeting me I wouldn't want to help me because it is someone else.

The fact that I'm still here amazes me sometimes, I tried to ignore or power through the things in my head almost my whole life up until a few months ago. When I started seeing help things got a little better, just opening up to someone was a huge deal.
For the second question I'm not sure if you mean in general or for some cases where it gets bad. So I'll answer both.
In general just keeping my head off of bad thoughts. I have to constantly be aware of my thoughts and whenever I get negative thoughts I try to change the subject.
For really bad days where hallucinations or voices are acting up, and just trying to ignore them not let them get to me. Reddit helps a lot for keeping my mind off of that when I'm alone.
Haha yes sometimes.

I see this as the same question as the one above so I'll give the same answer. I believe it was when my parents divorced when I was younger. My father left without ever saying a word leaving me to take care of my mother and sister.
I believe it was when my parents divorced when I was younger. My father left without ever saying a word leaving me to take care of my mother and sister.

Drastically. There are a lot of nights were I can't sleep because of anxiety or fear which makes me tired throughout my entire day so I don't get out much or end up taking long naps. I'm not very good at talking to people, I tend to have extreme opinions and say whatever is on my mind.

Stuff like this usually tends to take anywhere from 4-6 weeks to actually have an effect, and I've been on them for 4. So far as I can tell, no they are not working. Hopefully that will change though.
